Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer erred in concluding the marriage was not genuine
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Permanent residence application under spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer questioned credibility based on interview discrepancies
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider all relevant evidence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Marriage deemed not genuine; application refused
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Did the officer unreasonably ignore documentary evidence?
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for redetermination by another officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about authenticity of marriage despite supporting documentation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Selective reliance on minor discrepancies while disregarding strong objective evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide adequate reasons for discounting evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Alleged lack of consistency in spousal interviews
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged reasonableness of decision via judicial review

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in finding the marriage not genuine
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Permanent residence application following refugee claim
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer assessed lack of credibility due to interview inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Spousal sponsorship after refugee status determination
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to properly analyze and reconcile contradictory evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Medical records showing shared family involvement
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Marriage deemed not genuine; application rejected
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Did the officer reasonably dismiss documentary evidence of a genuine marriage?
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case remitted for redetermination by a different officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of genuineness in marriage despite substantial supporting evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Disregard of objective evidence without sufficient justification
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Lack of transparent reasoning in rejecting key evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in answers during separate interviews of spouses
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Insufficient engagement with available documentary proof
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to account for or explain dismissal of credible evidence
